BR_text.BRsummary: Mac OSX build in PyPi targets OSX 10.14
BR_text.BRdescription:
Describe the bug
 Prior versions targeted 10.6+ (e..g onnxruntime-0.5.0-cp36-cp36m-macosx_10_7_x86_64.whl) but the for 1.0 only 10.14 is targeted (e.g. onnxruntime-1.0.0-cp36-cp36m-macosx_10_14_x86_64.whl). Some of us aren't that cutting edge - is there any way to push a build similar to the prior releases? Building from source is a bit of a pain, but an ok workaround.
 <denchmark-link:https://pypi.org/project/onnxruntime/0.5.0/#files>0.5.0 Build</denchmark-link>
 
 <denchmark-link:https://pypi.org/project/onnxruntime/1.0/#files>1.0 Build</denchmark-link>
 
 Urgency
 Low.
 System information
 
 Mac OSX 10.13.6
 Python 3.6.5

comments_0.comment_text:
We built it on 10.14.
 We got the machine from:
 <denchmark-link:https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/pipelines/agents/hosted?view=azure-devops>https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/devops/pipelines/agents/hosted?view=azure-devops</denchmark-link>
 
 <denchmark-link:https://github.com/kkaehler>@kkaehler</denchmark-link>
   Is it possible to target 10.6 even the build was running on 10.14?

comments_2.comment_text:
Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/snnn>@snnn</denchmark-link>
  <denchmark-link:https://github.com/jywu-msft>@jywu-msft</denchmark-link>
 
 I second that and it would be great if we can use pip3 install onnxruntime==1.0 for macOS 10.6+
 many thanks,
 <denchmark-h:h3>System information</denchmark-h>
 
 <denchmark-code>Mac OSX 10.12.6
 Python 3.7.4
 </denchmark-code>
